question.body: Which type of lipid is most important in biological membranes?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Fats are used for energy storage.
Incorrect. Waxes are used as protective barrier (e.g. prevent water loss on waxy plant leaves).
Correct. Phospholipids contain a polar head and nonpolar tails, providing them the unique ability to assemble “tail to tail” in a cell membrane.
Incorrect. Oils are used for engergy storage.
Incorrect. Triglycerides are used for energy storage.
